did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Personal correspondence, drafts of articles, photocopies of published articles, and various reminiscences relating to Arizona history and Army experiences including the Apache campaigns.

repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Edward D. Tuttle papers(AZ 514). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Arizona pioneer; Army officer, 4th California Infantry, 1862-1865; and author of articles on Arizona history.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence, drafts of articles, photocopies of published articles, and various reminiscences relating to Arizona history and Army experiences including the Apache campaigns. Correspondence includes letters to his sister during his Army service, 1862-1865.

did.unittitle: Correspondence while in California and Arizona. October 1862-November 1866
Correspondence while at Fort Yuma. December 1866-Semptember 1868
Correspondence while at Camp Willow Grove, Camp Mohave, Gila Bend, and Fort Yuma. October 1868-January 1869
Correspondence while an employee of the Colorado Steam Navigation Company. March 1869-May 1870
Correspondence while a resident of California. 1870-1876
Photocopies of correspondence to and from Tuttle concerning Arizona history. 1922-1927

Photocopies of manuscript drafts of articles by Tuttle on Arizona history (primarily about Graham, Mohave, Yavapai, and Yuma Counties); his experiences as an officer in the 4th California Infantry, and the Apache campaigns. 1862-1928
Photocopies of correspondence to his sister. 1862-1865
Photocopies of newspaper articles on Arizona history. 1922
Photocopies of an article by Tuttle: Article on the Pueblo Viejo Valley which appeared in The Arizonan, Volume 1, Numbers 49-50. January 19, 1899-February 1899
Photocopies of an article by Tuttle: Article entitled The River Colorado in Arizona Historical Review, pages 50-68. July 1928
